link:labelLink.link:label: Financial Position 1
Assets Adjustments Fair Value Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the difference between the value of the assets/liabilities as determined per the relevant Accounting Standards and the fair value of those assets/liabilities as determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
Assets Concentration Limit Value Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of appropriate asset concentration limits determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
Assets Debt Securities And Deposits Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of debt securities held by the reporting party, plus the value of deposits and placements that have been classified by the reporting party as assets backing insurance liabilities for statutory reporting purposes. A debt security is a transferable instrument evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.
Assets Debt Securities Not Bills Of Exchange Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of debt securities held by the reporting party. For the purposes of this item, exclude those debt securities which are classified as bills of exchange. The value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.A debt security is a transferable instrument evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.A bill of exchange is an unconditional order drawn (issued) by one party, sent to another party for acceptance and made out to, or to the order of, a third party, or to bearer. It is a negotiable instrument that binds each endorser of the bill to pay on redemption should the acceptor fail to do so. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.
Assets Debt Securities Plus Accrued Income Indexed Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of indexed debt securities including income accrued but not received. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards.
Debt securities are transferable instruments evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable income stream that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.
Indexed debt securities pay an income stream that is dependent on an external factor.
Assets Debt Securities Plus Accrued Income Non Indexed Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non-indexed debt securities, including income accrued but not received. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards.
Debt securities are transferable instruments evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable income stream that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.
Non-indexed debt securities pay an income stream that is not dependent on any external factor.
Assets Deferred Tax Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Deferred Tax Assets. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
Assets Derivative Instruments Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of derivative financial instruments held by the reporting entity that give it a contractual right to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another party under conditions that are potentially favourable. (That is where it represents net gain to the reporting entity) as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
Derivatives are generally defined as those instruments/contracts, where the value is based on other products, and/or on prices associated with financial products. Derivative contracts involve:
- Future delivery, receipt, or exchange of financial items such as cash or another derivative instrument; or
- Future exchange of real assets for financial items where the contract may be tradeable and has a market value.
The contracts can either be binding on both parties (e.g. as with a currency swap) or subject to the exercise by one party of a right contained within the contract (as with options).
Assets Equity Securities Other Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of equity securities that are not listed on a recognised Australian stock exchange plus the value of equity securities issued by a non-resident of Australia that are listed on a recognised Australian stock exchange.
Equity securities are, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, contracts that evidence a residual interest in the assets of an entity after deducting all its liabilities.
Assets Equity Securities Plus Accrued Income Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of equity securities plus income accrued but not received. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards. Equity securities are, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, contracts that evidence a residual interest in the assets of an entity after deducting all its liabilities.
Assets Excluding Deferred Acquisition Costs Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of assets excluding deferred acquisition costs arising in respect of policies. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards. Acquisition costs, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, are the fixed and variable costs of acquiring new business including commissions and similar distribution costs, and costs of accepting, issuing and initially recording policies.
Assets Financial Excluding Derivatives Amount
This is the value, at the relevant date, of all financial assets as defined in relevant accounting standards. For the purposes of this item, exclude derivatives.
Assets Goodwill And Other Intangible Assets Net Impairment And Amortisation Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of goodwill net of impairment and other intangible net of both impairment and amortisation. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
Goodwill is calculated as the excess of the cost of a business combination over the acquirer's interest in the net fair value of the identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities. It represents the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognised.
Assets Interest Bearing Securities Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of interest bearing securities. Interest bearing securities are debt securities paying an income stream based upon an interest rate consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for investment securities in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
Assets Loans And Advances Impairment Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provisions for impairment in relation to loans and advances receivable by the reporting party.
Loans and advances are those financial assets categorised as "Loans and Receivables" in the accounting standards, other than "Trade Receivables" and "Cash".
Assets Loans And Advances Including Accrued Interest Gross Provisions Impairment And Deferred Fee Income Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of loans and advances provided, gross of associated provisions for impairment and deferred fee income, and including any accrued interest. Loans and advances are those financial assets categorised as "Loans and receivables" in the accounting standards other than "Trade receivables" and "Cash".
Assets Loans And Advances Including Accrued Interest Net Provisions Impairment And Deferred Fee Income Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, the principal amount of loans and advances provided, net of associated provisions for impairment and deferred fee income, and including any accrued interest.
Loans and advances are those financial assets categorised as 'Loans and receivables' in the accounting standards other than 'Trade receivables' and 'Cash'.
Assets Loans Plus Accrued Income Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of loans classified as assets, plus income accrued but not received in relation to this asset. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards. Loans include, but are not limited to, financial leases and mortgages. Loans differ from interest bearing securities as usually the asset is non negotiable (i.e. able to be traded on a secondary market).
Assets Net Assets Adjusted Capital Adequacy Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the net assets of the reporting party adjusted in accordance with the requirements of relevant prudential standards.
Assets Non Investment Other Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date for this balancing item in the list it is being used.
Report the value, of any asset that has not been classified as an investment asset, other than receivables.
Assets Non Investment Other Net Market Value Amount

This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.
This is the value, as at the relevant date,of any other non investment asset which cannot be classified elsewhere within the list of assets backing policy liabilities. Net market value, or fair value, is the amount which could be expected to be received from the disposal of an asset in an orderly market; or in an arm's length transaction between knowledgeable, willing parties; after deducting costs expected to be incurred in realising the proceeds of such a disposal.
Assets Receivables Not Premiums Not Non Reinsurance Not Tax Assets Current Amount

This is the balancing item in the list in which it is being used. This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non-reinsurance receivables other than premiums, non-reinsurance recoveries and current tax assets.
Assets Receivables Other Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, for receivables other than: - outstanding insurance premiums - receivables in relation to investment assets - income accrued- deferred acquisition costs as defined by the relevant Australian Accounting Standards.
Assets Surplus Deficit Deferred Tax Assets Over Liabilities Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any surplus/deficit of deferred tax assets (DTA) over deferred tax liabilities (DTL). DTA and DTL are determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards; the netting of these items is in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
Assets Tax Benefits Asset Risk Stresses Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of tax benefits arising from the application of asset risk stresses. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
Assets Tax Benefits Insurance Risk Stresses Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all tax benefits arising from the application of insurance risk stresses. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
Assets Total Excluding Deferred Acquisition Costs Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of assets excluding deferred acquisition costs arising in respect of policies. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards. An asset is, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, a resource: (a) controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and (b) from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity. Acquisition costs, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, are the fixed and variable costs of acquiring new business including commissions and similar distribution costs, and costs of accepting, issuing and initially recording policies. (Acquisition costs relate to the costs incurred in acquiring specific life insurance contracts during the relevant period. They do not include the general growth and development costs incurred by a life insurer.)
Assets Total Other General Insurance Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total other assets, including prepayments, surplus in defined benefit superannuation fund, non-current assets and disposal groups classified as held for sale as well as any other assets that have not been disclosed.
Assets Transfers Between Hierarchy Level Amount
This is the value, during the relevant period, of assets transferred between different Fair Value Hierarchy Levels, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
Assets Unrealised Gains Including Derivative Liabilities Amount
This is the value, as at the reporting date, of the cumulative year to date gains in the unrealised asset value. For the purposes of this item include the unrealised gains on derivative liabilities.
Assets Unrealised Losses Including Derivative Liabilities Amount
This is the value, as at the reporting date, of the cumulative year to date unrealised losses on financial assets including derivatives liabilities.
Equity Current Year Earnings Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of current year profits (or losses), as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
Equity Current Year Earnings Upfront Fee Income Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the upfront fee income component of the current year profits (or losses), as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
Equity Minority Interests Fully Consolidated ADI Or Overseas Equivalent Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date of minority interests (as defined in accordance to relevant accounting standards) arising from the issue of ordinary shares by fully consolidated Authorised Deposit-taking institutions or overseas equivalents held by third parties. This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined as per relevant prudential standards.
Equity Net Assets Life Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net assets as calculated in accordance with the Life Insurance Act 1995. This amount is not necessarily equal to net assets per the entity's general purpose accounts.
Liabilities Borrowings Excluding Seed Capital Including Overdrafts Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, for borrowings, plus overdrafts less any borrowings classified as seed capital. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards. Borrowings are amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid. Seed capital is the preliminary contribution of funding toward the financing of a new business. Commonly this is in the form of a loan, usually provided by a related entity.
Liabilities Borrowings Plus Overdrafts Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, borrowings, including overdrafts. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards.
Borrowings are amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
Liabilities Derivative Instruments Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of derivative financial instruments held by the reporting entity that give it a contractual obligation to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another party under conditions that are potentially unfavourable.(That is where it represents net loss to the reporting entity) as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
Derivatives are generally defined as those instruments/contracts, where the value is based on other products, and/or on prices associated with financial products.
Derivative contracts involve:
- Future delivery, receipt, or exchange of financial items such as cash or another derivative instrument; or
- Future exchange of real assets for financial items where the contract may be tradeable and has a market value.
The contracts can either be binding on both parties (e.g. as with a currency swap) or subject to the exercise by one party of a right contained within the contract (as with options).
Liabilities Exposures Borrowings Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to borrowings. Borrowings are generally amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties.
On-balance sheet refers to those assets, liabilities, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
Liabilities Exposures Other Amount

This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used. It is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to other liabilities.
An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties.
On-balance sheet refers to those assets, liabilities, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
Liabilities Exposures Trade Creditors Accruals Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to trade creditors and accruals (including goods and services tax payable but not income tax payable).
An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties.
On-balance sheet refers to those assets, liabilities, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
Liabilities Financial Excluding Derivatives Amount
This is the value, at the relevant date, of all financial liability as defined in relevant accounting standards. For the purposes of this item, exclude derivatives.
Liabilities Liquidity Support Facilities Available Approved Limit Amount

This is the total approved balance, as at the relevant date, of liquidity support facilities contracted to the reporting party. The approved balance of a facility is the maximum approved amount that can be drawn down in relation to that facility. Liquidity support facilities are contracted by entities to supplement their liquidity management practices, and include the following: - Standby facilities; - Bill acceptance/discount facilities; - Letter of credit facilities; - Overdrafts; and - Other liquidity support facilities contracted.
Liabilities Other Balance Sheet Liabilities Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, for liabilities other than: - Borrowings- Trade and other payables- Provisions- Gross policy liabilities- Policy owner retained profits- Unearned premium income- Approved subordinated debt Liabilities, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, are present obligations of an entity arising from past events, the settlement of which is expected to result in an outflow from the entity of resources embodying economic benefits.
Liabilities Seed Capital Borrowings Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of borrowings classified as seed capital. Seed capital is the preliminary contribution of funding toward the financing of a new business. Commonly this is in the form of a loan, usually provided by a related entity.
Borrowings are amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
Liabilities Standby Facilities Available Approved Limit Amount

This is the total approved balance, as at the relevant date, of standby facilities approved and committed to the reporting party.
A standby facility is an arrangement in which a party has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit. Generally, the drawing party is required to provide written notice to trigger draw down (access to the funds) on these facilities.
The approved balance of a facility is the maximum approved amount that can be drawn down in relation to that facility.
Liabilities Subordinated Debt Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of subordinated debt, as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards. Subordinated debt is that debt which is ranked lower in priority than other senior debt, including policyholders. In the event of bankruptcy, subordinated debt holders receive payment only after senior debt claims are paid in full.
Liabilities Subordinated Debt Eligible Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of eligible subordinated debt, as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards. Subordinated debt is that debt which is ranked lower in priority than other senior debt, including policyholders. In the event of bankruptcy, subordinated debt holders receive payment only after senior debt claims are paid in full.
Liabilities Subordinated Debt Non Eligible Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non eligible subordinated debt, as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards. Subordinated debt is that debt which is ranked lower in priority than other senior debt, including policyholders. In the event of bankruptcy, subordinated debt holders receive payment only after senior debt claims are paid in full.
Liabilities Transfers Between Hierarchy Level Amount
This is the value, during the relevant period, of liabilities transferred between different fair value hierarchy levels, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
Liabilities Unrealised Gain Excluding Derivatives Amount
This is the value, as at the reporting date, of the cumulative year to date gains in the unrealised liability value. For the purposes of this item exclude all derivatives.
Liabilities Unrealised Losses Excluding Derivatives Amount
This is the value, as at the reporting date, of the cumulative year to date unrealised losses on financial liabilities excluding all derivatives.
Off Balance Sheet Assets Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to off-balance sheet assets.
An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments and contingent liabilities from on- or off-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties.
Off-balance sheet exposures refer to items that are not recognised in the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, such as contingent assets and liabilities.
Off Balance Sheet Assets Subject To Charge Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the assets that are subject to the charge or encumbrance.
Off Balance Sheet Charge Outstanding Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the outstanding value of the charge or encumbrance given over assets of the reporting party.
Off Balance Sheet Charge Principal Amount
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the principal or face value or amount of the charge or encumbrance given over assets of the reporting party.
Off Balance Sheet Credit Derivatives Sold Protection Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, for off balance sheet credit derivatives where protection is sold. This is where the reporting entity assumes the credit risk by selling protection to a third party. Upon this party calling on this protection the reporting entity is obliged to pay cash and provide for a claim to receive a financial asset.
Off Balance Sheet Irrevocable Commitments Not Standby Facilities Not Credit Lines Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any irrevocable commitments that are not formal standby facilities or credit lines. These are non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities relating to the maximum unused portion of any irrevocable commitments that could be drawn during the remaining period to maturity.
In reporting this item the reporting entity is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Off Balance Sheet Liabilities Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to off-balance sheet liabilities.
An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments and contingent liabilities from on- or off-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties.
Off-balance sheet exposures refer to items that are not recognised in the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, such as contingent assets and liabilities.
Off Balance Sheet Undrawn Formal Standby Facilities Amount

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities relating to formal standby facilities or credit lines.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
In reporting this item the reporting entity is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
